Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

FIG. 11 shows the blocking effect of homologue A4D2 on Chitinase A. Non-linear fit, f=y0+a*exp(−b*x) is indicated. The 50% inhibitory concentration (IC50) for A4D2 was calculated as 17 μM.
FIG. 14 shows the blocking effect of ChOS lot G040823 on Chitinase A. The IC50 was calculated as 70 μg/ml.

Here are the extracted sentences/rows that meet the criteria:

* The resulting IC50 was calculated 17 μM for the A4D2 homologue.
* The IC50 was 70 μg/ml for G040823 (FIG. 14), 105 μg/ml for G050421 and 67 μg/ml for the ultra-filtrated G050421UF.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* The values of the dissociation constants are also decreasing with increasing DP and constant F<sub>A </sub>as the comparison of D<sub>3</sub>A<sub>3</sub>, (F<sub>A </sub>0.5; Kd 51.1 μM) and D<sub>5</sub>A<sub>6 </sub>(F<sub>A </sub>0.55; K<sub>1 </sub>6.9 M) shows.
* Interestingly, the K<sub>4 </sub>values are even decreasing with increasing number of D units but constant number of A units as the comparison of A<sub>6 </sub>(6 A units; K 13.6 μM) and D<sub>5</sub>A<sub>6 </sub>(6 A units: K<sub>d </sub>6.9 μM) shows (the K<sub>d </sub>of D<sub>5</sub>A<sub>6 </sub>is 14% of the K<sub>d </sub>for D<sub>3</sub>A<sub>3</sub>).
* The dissociation constants found for D<sub>6</sub>, D<sub>3</sub>A<sub>3</sub>, D<sub>2</sub>A<sub>4</sub>, A<sub>6</sub>, and D<sub>5</sub>A<sub>6 </sub>were all in the μmolar range (FIG. 16).
* The inset in FIG. 17 shows the relative affinities [%](D<sub>6</sub>=0% and A<sub>6</sub>=100%) with still 90.8% of the maximum affinity for D<sub>3</sub>A<sub>3</sub>.
